---
title: "Sourcing a Python script"
output: html_notebook
---

## 1. Source flights.py

```{r}
# Use this in a Linux installation
reticulate::use_condaenv("anaconda2")
reticulate::py_config()
```

```{r}
library(reticulate)
source_python("flights.py")
flights <- read_flights("flights.csv")

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(flights, aes(AIRLINE, ARRIVAL_DELAY)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_jitter()
```

## 2. Source functions.py

```{r}
# will call script functions.py
source_python('functions.py')
add(5, 10)
```
